page.topic: Customizing Columns Shown in the Project Control Panel

description.p: If components or a5w pages contain comments and descriptions, you can display these in the Web Projects Control Panel by customizing the columns shown.

discussion.p: The columns shown in the Web Projects Control panel can be customized using the *[ui:Customize the columns shown in the Web Control Panel]* tool found in the *[ui:More...]* menu.

figure.title: The Web Projects Control Panel More menu
figure.alt: The Web Projects Control Panel More menu

description.p: You can customize column widths and additional columns to display in the Web Projects Control Panel in the *[ui:Customize Web Control Panel]* dialog. The "Headings" option in the left-hand column is the general settings for the Web Projects Control Panel.
You can define column widths using the *[code:{width=x}]* prefix before the column name. For example, to specify the width of the Comments column as 4 inches:
Changes to the columns are applied the next time you launch Alpha Anywhere.

section.title: Adding Comments and Descriptions to A5W pages

description.p: You can use the HTML markup shown below to add a comment or description to an A5W page. The comment and description will be shown on the Web Projects Control Panel in the Comment and Description columns.
To add a comment or description to an A5W page, open the A5W page in the HTML editor. Then, on the source tab, add your comment and description using the markup shown below:

p.example: <!-- comment -- this is the comment --> <!-- description -- this is the description -->

description.p: If the Comments and Description columns are not already shown in the Web Projects Control Panel, you will need to add them using the *[ui:]* tool under the More menu. You must restart Alpha Anywhere for the column changes to take effect.
